##### Notes

- Workaround: Putting `set ambiwidth=double` *before* `require`ing chatgpt doesn't cause the crash.
- It seems caused when ChatGPT.nvim shows some characters (e.g. [î‚¶](https://github.com/jackMort/ChatGPT.nvim/blob/3ff8403136e3298f45ff9d11456f922da5b9fc50/lua/chatgpt/chat.lua#L213)). I'm not sure which API of nvim is the root cause.

### Steps to reproduce

```bash
# Installing ChatGPT.nvim and its dependencies
wget https://github.com/jackMort/ChatGPT.nvim/archive/3ff8403136e3298f45ff9d11456f922da5b9fc50.tar.gz
tar xf 3ff8403136e3298f45ff9d11456f922da5b9fc50.tar.gz
wget https://github.com/MunifTanjim/nui.nvim/archive/ecd9def93891b9260b15b5fcef542eaabf4145c9.tar.gz
tar xf ecd9def93891b9260b15b5fcef542eaabf4145c9.tar.gz
wget https://github.com/nvim-lua/plenary.nvim/archive/9ac3e9541bbabd9d73663d757e4fe48a675bb054.tar.gz
tar xf 9ac3e9541bbabd9d73663d757e4fe48a675bb054.tar.gz
wget https://github.com/nvim-telescope/telescope.nvim/archive/6258d50b09f9ae087317e392efe7c05a7323492d.tar.gz
tar xf 6258d50b09f9ae087317e392efe7c05a7323492d.tar.gz

# Configure ChatGPT.nvim with a dummy API key and feed some chat log
export OPENAI_API_KEY=dummy_key
export XDG_STATE_HOME=`pwd`
mkdir -p "$XDG_STATE_HOME"/nvim/chatgpt/
cat <<END > "$XDG_STATE_HOME"/nvim/chatgpt/1681264724.json
{"settings":[],"name":"Hello","conversation":[{"text":"Hello","type":1},{"text":"hello","type":1},{"usage":{"prompt_tokens":15,"completion_tokens":9,"total_tokens":24},"text":"Hello! How can I assist you today?","type":2}],"updated_at":"2023-04-12_11:52:21"}
END

# Run nvim with the script below
nvim --clean -u script.vim

# Then launch ChatGPT
:ChatGPT
```

script.vim:

```vim
set rtp+=./ChatGPT.nvim-3ff8403136e3298f45ff9d11456f922da5b9fc50
set rtp+=./nui.nvim-ecd9def93891b9260b15b5fcef542eaabf4145c9
set rtp+=./plenary.nvim-9ac3e9541bbabd9d73663d757e4fe48a675bb054
set rtp+=./telescope.nvim-6258d50b09f9ae087317e392efe7c05a7323492d

" NOTE: putting `set ambiwidth=double` *before* `require`ing chatgpt doesn't cause the crash.
lua require('chatgpt').setup()
set ambiwidth=double
```

### Expected behavior

ChatGPT.nvim works without crashing.

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.9.0

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

N/A

### Operating system/version

Debian GNU/Linux 11.6

### Terminal name/version

Windows Terminal 1.16.10261.0

### $TERM environment variable

screen

### Installation

Source package from https://github.com/neovim/neovim/archive/refs/tags/v0.9.0.tar.gz
